title: headingnorth
author: headingnorth
content: I heard CryptosRUs mention it in one of his recent videos that Honda was accepting bitcoin and ethereum for payment in the US to buy Honda cars.If true, that would be huge. So I wanted to see if I could verify this claim and pulled up several news articles about Honda allegedly starting to accept bitcoin, ethereum and even other cryptos like XRP depending on the source. The problem is the only sources of this news are several lesser known crypto websites that I never heard of. I heard nothing about it in the major financial media outlets. The most ridiculous so far is the last one claiming Honda taking Shiba Inu for payments!Honda to accept Bitcoin and crypto paymentshttps://en.softonic.com/articles/honda-to-accept-bitcoin-and-crypto-payments?ex=RAMP-1114.0Honda and the Cryptocurrency Wavehttps://cryptoticker.io/en/honda-cryptocurrency-adoption/Honda Now Accepting Cryptocurrencies for Payments: Reporthttps://www.thecoinrepublic.com/2023/10/03/honda-now-accepting-cryptocurrencies-for-payments-report/This Automobile Giant Now Accepts Ripple (XRP) and Shiba Inu (SHIB) for Paymentshttps://cryptopotato.com/this-automobile-giant-now-accepts-ripple-xrp-and-shiba-inu-shib-for-payments/

comments.author: edmundduke
comments.body: They did step into a partnership with FCF Pay and announce that crypto can be used to buy Hondas now, so yeah, its probably true. Japan has been one of the leaders in this space as this is not the first auto company to start accepting crypto. Also buying cars with crypto is nothing new on secondary markets or even some 3rd party providers. Its only kind of "novel" for the large companies but im guessing it will become more and more normalized as adoption increases.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Why should it come as a news to you? Most automobile companies are looking to be creative and will do anything to keep trending and what better way to do that than to announce you now accept payment in Bitcoin? I mean this won't have raised much eyebrows if it were a company like say Ford or Tesla right? Some will view this as a positive for Bitcoin and an ever evolving move of digital finance, I call bull. They will not hesitate to scrap off the option once Bitcoin experiences a heavy price decline. And also, it would be nice if the Op locked the thread as more users have clearly pointed out that a topic has already been opened in the Economics board.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: headingnorth on October 04, 2023, 06:38:58 AMThis news still seems sketchy to me. I have not found anything  about it from a major mainstream news outlet. Honda has not announced anything about it on their US website and has not provided any press releases.The most reliable link was provided by Binance, but the problem is that Honda did not accept payments in Bitcoin directly, as happened with Tesla when it used BTCPAYSERVER to conduct transactions and bought Bitcoin, but rather through FCF Pay, which is listed on the BNB network.The news may be misleading because FCF Pay and Binance are the beneficiaries of this news, and this acceptance means that Bitcoin will be converted into dollars in their bank accounts and fees will be charged accordingly.This explains why they accept Bitcoin, Ethereum, Binance Coin, XRP, Doge, Shiba Inu + many more!Japanese Automobile Giant Honda Now Accepts Bitcoin and Ethereum As Payment Methods

Sales of all the other expensive goods are far not this scale. There are many specific expensive things for business: tools, hi-tech devices, machines, even the whole enterprises, but only a car and a house are bought by nearly everyone (even regardless of the region: the only difference is that in poor regions most people buy cheaper cars or cheaper types of transport, and houses of lower quality). So, increasing adoption level will let people buy cars directly with btc at some point...
